sub_title: Ma. Global Governance, Security, and Politics, Msc. Climate Policy, BA. Double Major in International Relations & Political Science.
summary:
Vincent Noteboom is a MA graduate from SIS American University (Ranked a Top 10 institution for International Affairs) and has an MSc in International Relations with a focus on Climate and Energy Policy from the Universiteit van Amsterdam. Vincent has gained professional experience working in The Netherlands, the United States, and Japan. This professional experience was in Banking, Cyber-Security, International Diplomacy, Legislative Research, International Negotiations, and Combatting Climate Change. He speaks English and Dutch Natively and is studying German, French, and Spanish. 
Vincent's passions are equitable solution for Climate Change, Human Rights and Privacy, IT development and Regulation, and Conflict Resolution through International Governance and Diplomacy.

company.name: Delegation of the European Union to the United States

profile_positions.company: Delegation of the European Union to the United States
profile_positions.description:
• Tracking developments, analysing, and drafting a weekly brief on disinvestment from the EU to the U.S. caused by the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA)
• Attended the Verband Deutscher Maschinen und Anlagenbau (VDMA) conference, at the Delegation of German Industry and Commerce (AHK), for stakeholder engagement and drafted a report on the solar energy industry's needs and concerns regarding EU vs US legislation and investment climate
• Researching, analysing, and briefing the Head of the Trade and Agriculture Section on the semiconductor industry, the Wassenaar agreement, and export controls imposed on lithograph producer ASML
• Organizing and composing briefings and memos on; U.S. congressional hearings, policy, and legislation such as CHIPS for America, AUKUS and the Australian Nuclear Submarine Deal, the NDAA 2023, Made in America, EU Chips Act, EU Digital Service Act/Digital Market Act, and the Lame Duck Session of 2022
• Analysing policy and economic developments in EU-U.S. trade relations including the consequences of the Inflation Reduction Act, Export Controls on Advanced Semiconductors, European automotive manufacturing plants, and employment data in the U.S., and EV Tax Credit consequences for foreign automotive companies
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.description:
• Analysing policy developments and writing policy memos on Congressional Committee hearings, SolarWinds, and Enterprise Cyber Security Practices to inform the ISA Board on current discussions and developments regarding internet security
• Executing qualitative research on the overlap between the World Economic Forum and the U.S. Federal Government’s cybersecurity objectives, ascertaining potential areas of cooperation and advancements
• Profiling, researching, and writing briefings on U.S. congressional members with key shared interests regarding internet security and cyber warfare, drafting background documents on legislative priorities, the composition of their constituents, and talking points for potential meetings
• Coordinating and assisting in campaigning for a new DOD cyber academy which successfully became part of the National Defence Authorization Act (NDAA) 2022
• Researching, editing, rewriting, and updating chapters 2 & 3 of the handbook; Cyber Security for Business
profile_positions.title: Policy Analyst

profile_positions.description:
• Constructing and executing statistical methods to classify the effectiveness of nature/technology-based carbon sequestration processes by comparing the relative cost per gram of CO2 sequestered
• Identifying researching verifying, and presenting carbon reduction and sequestration processes, such as the expansion of mango forests, sea and atmospheric CO2 extraction, synthetic fuels, kinetic and chemical-based battery storage for renewables 
• Investigating and harmonizing existing approaches using qualitative methods to ensure that the carbon sequestration processes accounted for Social Justice
• Creating, editing, and writing a report summarizing all qualitative and statistical quantitative findings
profile_positions.title: Consultant
